sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to intersection.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Find the symmetric difference of A and B and the intersection of the symmetric difference of B and A with set B. Show that the intersection of the symmetric difference of A and B with set B is not equal to the symmetric difference of the intersection of A and B with B and the intersection of B complement and A complement.
